title: How to Bake a Chocolate Chip Banana Cake

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit or 175 degrees Celsius.
Grease and flour a cake pan.
Cream the margarine, eggs, and sugar in a bowl.
steps.description: Mix well with an electric mixer until light and fluffy.

steps.headline: Fold in the mashed bananas and vanilla extract.
In a separate bowl, combine the dry ingredients.
steps.description: Whisk the flour, cocoa powder, baking soda, and baking powder until fully combined.

steps.headline: Slowly pour in the dry ingredients and fold in the sour milk and chocolate chips.
steps.description: Blend on low speed, blending until well-combined with no flour streaks showing.

steps.headline: Pour the cake batter into the cake pan.
Bake the cake in the oven for about 40 minutes until fully baked.
Allow the cake to cool for about 10 minutes until cool enough to touch.
Serve.
steps.description: Slice the cake into pieces. Place one slice on a serving plate. Garnish with extra banana slices. Enjoy!

text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit or 175 degrees Celsius.  Grease and flour a cake pan.  Cream the margarine, eggs, and sugar in a bowl. Mix well with an electric mixer until light and fluffy. Fold in the mashed bananas and vanilla extract.  In a separate bowl, combine the dry ingredients. Whisk the flour, cocoa powder, baking soda, and baking powder until fully combined. Slowly pour in the dry ingredients and fold in the sour milk and chocolate chips. Blend on low speed, blending until well-combined with no flour streaks showing. Pour the cake batter into the cake pan.  Bake the cake in the oven for about 40 minutes until fully baked.  Allow the cake to cool for about 10 minutes until cool enough to touch.  Serve. Slice the cake into pieces. Place one slice on a serving plate. Garnish with extra banana slices. Enjoy!
